channel.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
channel.description:
*"The most powerful piece in chess is the Queen."*
> # [color = "steblue"] The Queen [/color] :shield: > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Killer (Unique) [/color]** **Royal Blood (Passive)** - As a Royal, you can put your name forward for nominations to become the next King. **Iron Will (Passive)** - Immune to occupation and target changing. When converted, your class does not change, you do not know who the other Unseen/Cult are, you do not participate in their night chat and you do not count against their maximum number. **The Queen's Mark (Day)** - Choose a player to mark. This mark will disappear at the end of the night. - Infinite uses **Black Dagger (Night)** - Stalk a target. If a marked player visits your target, you will attack them. - Infinite uses **Mask of Steel (Night)** - You will stay on guard tonight, becoming immune to death. Investigative abilities used on you tonight will be prevented. If a marked player visits you, you will attack them. - 3 uses *Defeat the Unseen or Cult and any neutrals that seek to do you harm.*
This is an idea I had for a powerful and dangerous BD class that can be very useful or very harmful depending on how it's used and whether it gets converted. Feedback appreciated!

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
For a Town-sided role, any role that can’t be easily confirmed, doesn’t have negative utilities, nor has abilities that give too much information can be considered good roles.

IMO I like that ToL basically has a shit-ton of interesting roles, though my main issue with the game is that way too many classes here either have instant or retroactive confirm-ability.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shurian:

Are there any good ideas that are not interesting?

Sheriff, physician, meny standard FM roles.

ToL doesn’t have meny examples but Mafia games as a whole have more.

Read full topic

item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
All Cult roles, Assassin and Mastermind are also gendered roles in some way, so I do not think this is necessary. Adding more gendered portraits for these roles will just result in a lot of unnecessary work and possibly lead to confusion. This would also require making new portraits for all forms of king, neutral/BD/evil/psycho.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
Are there any good ideas that are not interesting? I don’t believe so.

Therefore we pick the interesting ones, even they are horrible. See if they can be somehow worked on.

Read full topic

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
Or just keep the word King on the player list regardless if it’s a King or Queen, but still show the gender of the King itself to the King and use different portraits based on both gender and alignment.

Even then, many women in history have used the title of King rather than queen, so a female King isn’t too out of the ordinary.

item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Still broken. Extra kills are way better than you give them credit

Ergo why I’ve repeatedly said that the Queen’s converted class should be completely overhauled as OP has no idea how much impact KPN has on social deduction games. There’s a very good reason why no other Unseen or Cult class baring the Assassin and the Cult Leader could kill. Giving the evil factions an extra or god forbid two extra KPN would make the game too scum-sided. Even if it was only by chance this would cause too many games to be decided because the Queen got converted and ended up prematurely making BD lose majority from her abilities.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
There might be something interesting in a character that needs set-up time to perform a delayed action. Perhaps they can place an effect on a character that has a specific trigger, and then leave it there, the way the Mercenary’s Shield works now. A quick example:

Gem of Life (Night) - You leave a gemstone charged with healing magic on a player’s room. The gem triggers when the player is attacked, or begins the night poisoned or bleeding. If this ability is used while the gemstone is still active, it will move the existing one into another player’s room. - 3 uses

Gem of Poison (Night) - You leave a gemstone charged with poison on a player’s room. The gem triggers when the player leaves their room, poisoning them. If this ability is used while the gemstone is still active, it will move the existing one into another player’s room. - 1 use

Gem of Darkness (Night) - You leave a gemstone charged with shadows on a player’s room. The gem triggers when the player is the target of an investigation effect, preventing it. If this gem triggers, the target’s visits will be undetectable. If this ability is used while the gemstone is still active, it will move the existing one into another player’s room. - 2 uses

Gem of Shielding (Day) - You will crush a protective gemstone to prevent all visits to you. - 2 uses.

Just an example of how the mechanic could work.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Yes but how is that better than sellsword or sorcerer who can have all of that plus:

1: The challenge of finding each other

2: The possibility of BD faking the class to coax information from a known scum.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword

item.title: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
The added layer of difficulty in communication means that even if you know if the class has been converted or not, you don’t know if the plans will be carried out successfully. The fact that the communication can be intercepted or deciphered allows for the other party to make adjustments accordingly, adding to the uncertainty as to the result of the night’s activities.

Read full topic
item.source: The Queen, Blue Dragon's Double-Edged Sword
